intro: Corydalis minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf-flowered corydalis, is a delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Due to its small size and ornamental flowers, it is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in specialized horticultural settings.
